intro: Achillea conferta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, linear leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Achillea conferta is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
